fields.description: After logging in to AWS with the user console, the resource counts on the dashboard never resolve.

comments.body: There were a few of us seeing this on the same setup (with different accounts). [~shaon] restarted the console and all of us do not see the behavior anymore.  Don;t want to close this just yet but downgrading the severity.

It's not working after a couple of minutes. Seeing a lot of following on CLI,
{noformat}
Message from syslogd@d-35 at Oct 10 14:29:57 ...
 �<14>set new ec2 connection for host : ec2.us-west-2.amazonaws.com

Message from syslogd@d-35 at Oct 10 14:29:57 ...
 �<14>set new ec2 connection for host : ec2.us-west-1.amazonaws.com

Message from syslogd@d-35 at Oct 10 14:29:57 ...
 �<14>set new ec2 connection for host : ec2.ap-southeast-1.amazonaws.com

Message from syslogd@d-35 at Oct 10 14:29:57 ...
 �<14>set new ec2 connection for host : ec2.ap-southeast-2.amazonaws.com

Message from syslogd@d-35 at Oct 10 14:30:16 ...
 �<14>set new ec2 connection for host : ec2.us-west-1.amazonaws.com
{noformat}
Upgrading the severity again. [~alice] has seen on another setup and we are experiencing it again. Need to be investigated.

just reproduced the bug on my POC setup https://10.111.5.4:8888

Steps:

Updated packages and restarted all eucalyptus components. Opened UI in FF24.
On first log in I could see all the resource counts on dashboard. I created a volume successfully. Then I used the Launch instance wizard from Instances Landing page and I removed the filter in the images list. Browser became super slow at this point. Then I saw some "Unresponsive java script" errors. Could not navigate away from Launch Instance wizard for a while, when I finally managed to navigate to dashboard, the resource counts would not resolve. Saw these messages in the terminal:
{code}
Message from syslogd@h-04 at Oct 10 14:22:16 ...
 ?<14>set new ec2 connection for host : ec2.eu-west-1.amazonaws.com

Message from syslogd@h-04 at Oct 10 14:22:16 ...
 ?<14>set new ec2 connection for host : ec2.sa-east-1.amazonaws.com

Message from syslogd@h-04 at Oct 10 14:22:16 ...
 ?<14>set new ec2 connection for host : ec2.us-east-1.amazonaws.com

Message from syslogd@h-04 at Oct 10 14:22:16 ...
 ?<14>set new ec2 connection for host : ec2.ap-northeast-1.amazonaws.com

Message from syslogd@h-04 at Oct 10 14:22:16 ...
 ?<14>set new ec2 connection for host : ec2.us-west-2.amazonaws.com

Message from syslogd@h-04 at Oct 10 14:22:16 ...
 ?<14>set new ec2 connection for host : ec2.us-west-1.amazonaws.com

Message from syslogd@h-04 at Oct 10 14:22:16 ...
 ?<14>set new ec2 connection for host : ec2.ap-southeast-1.amazonaws.com

Message from syslogd@h-04 at Oct 10 14:22:16 ...
 ?<14>set new ec2 connection for host : ec2.ap-southeast-2.amazonaws.com

Message from syslogd@h-04 at Oct 10 14:22:17 ...
 ?<14>set new ec2 connection for host : ec2.us-west-1.amazonaws.com
{code}
Attached screenshot. FF24 became unresponsive, impossible to log out. I had to force quit the browser.
Yeah, the dash worked for me and then.....it didn't.
I use chrome. and am seeing the same problem.
This is baaad. Has to go in.
This seems related to what I'm seeing in EUCA-7828
[~alice], [~neil], [~jloza]: This appears to be a duplicate of EUCA-7828, assuming the trigger is removing the initial search filter in the Create Instance dialog.
[~kgill] seems, or for sure are related?
[~jloza]: For sure, since I can't reproduce 7836 unless the steps in 7828 are followed.
[~kgill], we should clarify if anyone besides me removed filter in launch instances dialog.  I am not sure that is the case.
this does not duplicate, but they are related. Can that link change from duplaicte to something more appropriate?
AFAIK [~ethomas] saw that dashboard never resolves on log-in.  I tested on a different setup, perhaps my comment belongs in EUCA-7828 thread.
for me, when owner=amazon filter is lifted, chrome becomes completely unresponsive.
afaik, this is related to slow describe-images as it attempts to fetch all aws images. Ajax apps are single-threaded, so it won't return control until AWS sends back result (or error).
[~spark]: Yep, that's what we reported in EUCA-7828
@jloza: Replaced "duplicates" with "relates to" EUCA-7828 until we can confirm otherwise
[~kgill] ok thanks. better safe than sorry.

The big thing that happens when removing the owner=amazon filter is that the browser starts using the allimages collection which has 20k images. Before that, that collection may have been already cached in the proxy and possibly sent to the browser when ready. Depends on if the user logged in before the proxy cache was filled. Depending on network speed, it may take some time to get that list of images from proxy->browser, even with gzip on which takes the payload size down to about 4MB. (it used to be 36MB before some improvements, so this is much better than it used to be).

Another thing that "might" be going on is that we start getting excessive threads tending to the allimages cache. That shouldn't happen, so I'll throw in some debug and try a few AWS logins to see if that is behaving. that cache should only refresh every 20 minutes, so that really shouldn't load the proxy much, however we do that for each region, so that's 8x the data each 20 minutes. More to come...

After inserting some debug and logging in from 2 browsers with AWS and doing some navigation and removing owner=amazon, I don't see suspected repeated fetches of large image sets.
This message "set new ec2 connection for host : ec2.us-west-2.amazonaws.com" and others like it will happen when a user logs with aws. The proxy takes the most recent credentials to use for fetching public images, so that it will have the best shot at refreshing those caches when required. Those message should correspond with logging in (with aws creds). You'd see 8 of those messages at that time. If changing regions (with the region drop-down after logging in), you'd see a single message as the new region is set. I've tested with 2 simultaneous users, so maybe I'm not loading things enough.

One thing I want to explore is that every resource is loaded as we move between landing pages. This ensures the data is current, but for large image sets, it is really overkill. I want to look at turning this off and relying solely on push. I know the proxy flags data sets as requiring a push if they are being newly fetched, so that we *should* see the same performance. This will reduce loading that large image set.

I've just seen a case where the I login with a fresh browser (but a proxy that's been used to login a few times) and the dash totals don't populate. I saw errors from the proxy that complain about not being able to push messages. I have another browser open at the same time who's session still works fine. Looks like a problem isolated to this new session. Investigating.

[~dkavanagh]: I see there's a pull request open, but we didn't update the status of this ticket to set a reviewer.  

Feel free to submit patch and assign me as reviewer, since I'm reviewing pull request https://github.com/eucalyptus/eucalyptus-console/pull/144

This one probably doesn't solve the problem in all cases, but the fixes here (as described in the commit messages) minimize fetches from the browser and end up deferring the fetch of large image sets till needed. Overall win I think.

checking out the feature branch after commits, this seems to be working much better. I clicked around in AWS, removed default filter on image landing page, waited a bit while the full image set loaded (without panic, thanks to the loading indicator!) and then the dash updated right away, even after logging out and back in.

[~dkavanagh]: Testing the EUCA-7836 branch, I'm not seeing any images come up with the default owner:amazon filter after logging into aws and clicking the Launch new instance button.  The images display with that default filter on the testing branch though.

/cc [~jloza]
me neither. sadface.

[~dkavanagh], [~jloza]: I added two commits to the pull request at https://github.com/eucalyptus/eucalyptus-console/pull/144 to fix the empty images regressions in the Create instance and Create launch config wizards.  I didn't merge the PR since I'd like a code review and confirmation, but if we could get it tested and hopefully merged early Friday that would be great.

[~eans]: Not sure if you've started work on EUCA-7828, but you may want to review the changes in https://github.com/eucalyptus/eucalyptus-console/pull/144 first.
Many comments on PR and commits about what's been changed. please read to set expectations. User comments so far have been "feels much faster".

[~dkavanagh]: My gut feeling is, unless (or maybe even if?) there's a quick fix for the empty instances page, we should rip out pull request 144 from testing since many regressions were introduced in the 7836 branch.  My two fixes in that pull request were to fix two regressions, and we seem to have missed the more serious one w.r.t. instances, so who knows how many more there are.

/cc [~neil], [~jloza]
BTW, found the problem. trivial and only exhibits itself when a cluster of push messages comes in an some are mistakenly discarded. I'm coding the fix. Should I push in 7836, or right to testing?

Please make sure someone spot checks and verifies for regressions. We
really want to not introduce regressions right now.


On Fri, Oct 11, 2013 at 4:58 PM, David Kavanagh (JIRA) <




-- 

*    Neil Soman *


*    Co-founder & Director of Engineering*
No issues found after following the steps provided to reproduce. Also did multiple logins/outs and region changes and dashboard responded appropriately. Tested on Chrome.
